page.title: 19LOCAL DIALECT.
page.content: "Weel, its been a fine like day eh?" "Aye, nae bad, mind you its been a wee bit callir than yisterday." "Aye that's richt." "I heard on the wireless that its gain tae be coorse the morn,sna an' hail steens an a dinna ken fit else." "Ach that's nae sae fine like, onaewye, I'd bitter get gaan cheerio." "Aye cheerio, see at ae kirk on Sunday." {TRANSLATION: "Well, its been a nice day today" "Yes, not bad mind you its been a little bit colder than yesterday." "Yes that's right." "I heard on the radio that its going to be worse tomorrow,snow and hail and I don't know what else." "Thats not so good,anyway I'd better get going, good bye." "Goodbye,see you at church on Sunday."
